The state-level IIS databases have been in use for decades. This legislation actually bolsters their cyber defense, enhances the privacy of Americans, and prevents the Biden Administration from repurposing the IIS and using it to enforce vaccine mandates. (7/8)

However that bill lacked explicit legal definitions for what ‚Äúmodernization‚Äù meant. The Immunization Infrastructure Modernization Act actually limits what the Biden Administration can do using American Rescue Plan funding. (6/8)

This legislation is necessary because when President Biden‚Äôs first multi-trillion dollar proposal called the American Rescue Plan, which I voted against, was enacted it included funding to modernize IIS databases. (5/8)
I have also help lead efforts to overturn the CMS vaccine mandate as well as support legislation blocking mandates for federal employees and contractors. (4/8)
I have consistently opposed federal vaccine mandates and vaccine passports. In fact, I am an original cosponsor of H.J. Res 65, which would overturn OSHA‚Äôs vaccine mandate. (3/8)

The Immunization Infrastructure Modernization Act HR 550 is in no way, shape, or form related to a federal vaccine database or vaccine passport. In fact, the data contained in these state run systems has had all personally identifiable information removed from it. (2/8)
There has been a lot of misinformation about a vote on HR 550 that I took earlier this week and I wanted to clarify what the bill does and does not do. (1/8)

I want to thank @RepAlGreen and @RepAGonzalez for working with me on this important small business lifeline. While Washington and our nation are no doubt divided, #WestMichigan and communities across America expect us to find a way to work together like we did today.
This amendment will provide increased flexibility and opportunity for people that earn income through Etsy, Shipt, DoorDash, or Lyft to name a few.
The pandemic has demonstrated the increased role of the gig economy. Today, over 1/4 of the US workforce participates in the gig economy or non traditional work in some capacity.

This bipartisan amendment sets aside $500 million (of the $10 Billion SSDCI) in direct support and credit options to help small businesses with less than 10 employees including independent contractors and sole proprietors.

Good news! My amendment to help small businesses passed the Financial Services Committee today by voice vote. At this point this is only the 2nd Republican-led Amendment to pass the House during the reconciliation process.
